Name: Lennox-Gastaut syndrome
Definition: A childhood electroclinical syndrome that is characterized by frequent seizures and intellectual disability that present in early childhood.

Name: early onset absence epilepsy
Definition: A childhood electroclinical syndrome characterized by the occurrence of typical absence seizures starting between the age of four and ten years.

Name: childhood absence epilepsy
Definition: A childhood electroclinical syndrome that is characterized by brief and frequent absence seizures in children with age of onset between four and ten years.

Name: Landau-Kleffner syndrome
Definition: An organ system cancer located in the hematological system that is characterized by uncontrolled cellular proliferation in blood

Name: benign epilepsy with centrotemporal spikes
Definition: A cognitive disorder that involves a disturbance in mood as the predominant underlying feature.

Name: obsolete chronic factitious illness with physical symptoms
Definition: A cognitive disorder that involves a disturbance in mood as the predominant underlying feature.
